name: Prowler
description: Open-source cloud security scanner — CIS, SOC 2, PCI-DSS, HIPAA compliance checks for AWS, Azure, GCP
auth_method: Cloud provider credentials (AWS IAM, Azure AD, GCP SA)

tools: run_checks — Execute security checks against cloud environment
list_checks — List available checks by framework
get_remediation — Get remediation guidance for findings

setup_steps: 1. Create a dedicated IAM role/user with SecurityAudit policy
2. For cross-account: Use AssumeRole with external ID
3. Install: pip install prowler (or use uvx for MCP)
5. For Azure/GCP: Configure respective service principals
security_notes: Use SecurityAudit managed policy — minimum permissions for scanning
Never use root/admin credentials for Prowler
Prowler reads config but never modifies infrastructure
Scan results may contain sensitive resource names — handle appropriately
